question: [File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Function: ConfigOptimizer::optimize()] [Partial Optimization] Does optimize() only handle enable_pre_commit but miss other validator-specific optimizations, allowing fullnodes to use validator-only features unsafely? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Function: is_consensus_only_perf_test_enabled()] [Feature Flag Bypass] Can the feature flag check in is_consensus_only_perf_test_enabled() be bypassed through conditional compilation manipulation, enabling performance test features in production builds? (High)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Function: is_consensus_only_perf_test_enabled()] [Compile-time vs Runtime] Does is_consensus_only_perf_test_enabled() only check compile-time features but miss runtime flags that could enable consensus-only testing in mainnet? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Enum: QcAggregatorType] [Deprecated Type Attack] Can the deprecated QcAggregatorType enum still be exploited through deserialization of old configs to cause unexpected behavior or crashes in QC aggregation? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Enum: QcAggregatorType] [Default Consistency] Does QcAggregatorType::NoDelay as default have security implications if old code paths still use this enum for aggregation logic? (Low)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Enum: ExecutionBackpressureMetric] [Percentile Manipulation] Can an attacker provide invalid percentile values (< 0 or > 1) to ExecutionBackpressureMetric::Percentile that cause calculation errors or panics? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Enum: ExecutionBackpressureMetric] [Mean vs Percentile] Can switching between Mean and Percentile metrics mid-operation cause inconsistent backpressure calculations that validators disagree on? (High)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Field Interaction: timeouts] [Timeout Cascade] Can the interaction between mempool_executed_txn_timeout_ms, mempool_txn_pull_timeout_ms, quorum_store_pull_timeout_ms, and round timeouts create cascading timeout scenarios that halt consensus? (High)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Field Interaction: block limits] [Limit Inconsistency] Can inconsistencies between max_sending_block_txns, max_sending_block_txns_after_filtering, max_sending_opt_block_txns_after_filtering create exploitable states where filtering allows oversized blocks? (High)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Field Interaction: backpressure configs] [Conflicting Backpressure] Can execution_backpressure, pipeline_backpressure, and chain_health_backoff mechanisms conflict, causing some to activate while others don't, resulting in inconsistent block size enforcement? (High)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Field Interaction: quorum_store fields] [Quorum Store Timing] Can mismatched quorum_store_pull_timeout_ms (400ms) and quorum_store_poll_time_ms (300ms) create race conditions in batch retrieval and block proposal timing? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Field Interaction: channel sizes] Can mismatched max_network_channel_size (1024), internal_per_key_channel_size (10), and intra_consensus_channel_buffer_size (10) create bottlenecks where messages queue in one channel but not others, causing deadlocks? (High)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Serde: deny_unknown_fields] [Field Injection] Does the deny_unknown_fields attribute on ConsensusConfig properly prevent attackers from injecting extra fields through YAML/JSON deserialization that could affect consensus behavior? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Serde: default] [Missing Field Attack] Can attackers exploit the #[serde(default)] attribute by omitting critical fields in config files, causing the system to use default values that may be insecure for certain deployments? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Serde: nested structs] [Nested Validation Bypass] Can nested structs like ExecutionBackpressureConfig contain invalid values that pass serde deserialization but aren't validated by sanitize(), creating exploitable misconfigurations? (High)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Arithmetic: MAX_RECEIVING_BLOCK_TXNS] [Overflow in Calculation] Can the calculation '10000.max(2 * MAX_SENDING_BLOCK_TXNS)' overflow if MAX_SENDING_BLOCK_TXNS is set to a very large value, causing unexpected small receive limits? (High)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Arithmetic: backoff calculations] [Exponential Overflow] Can the exponential backoff calculation using round_timeout_backoff_exponent_base ^ round_timeout_backoff_max_exponent overflow for certain base values, causing incorrect timeout values? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Arithmetic: percentage calculations] Can the backoff_if_below_participating_voting_power_percentage values (80, 78, 76, etc.) be exploited through integer division or rounding errors in voting power calculations? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Concurrency: config updates] [TOCTOU] Can time-of-check-time-of-use race conditions occur between sanitize() validation and actual config usage, allowing invalid configs to be applied mid-operation? (High)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Concurrency: channel sizes] [Channel Race] Can concurrent access to channels with limited sizes (internal_per_key_channel_size: 10) cause message drops or reordering when multiple threads send simultaneously? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Concurrency: backpressure updates] [Backpressure Race] Can concurrent updates to backpressure configurations while blocks are being proposed cause inconsistent block size limits across validators? (High)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Field: safety_rules] [Safety Rules Bypass] Can the safety_rules field be misconfigured to use insecure settings that allow double-signing or violation of safety guarantees? (Critical)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Field: safety_rules] [Data Directory Manipulation] Can manipulation of the safety_rules data directory (set via set_data_dir()) cause corruption of persistent safety data, enabling double-signing attacks? (Critical)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Field: quorum_store] [Batch Size Mismatch] Can the quorum_store configuration allow batches that exceed block limits, bypassing consensus block size enforcement? (Critical)

[File: config/src/config/consensus_config.rs] [Field: quorum_store] [Timeout Exploitation] Can mismatched timeout configurations between consensus and quorum store cause batch delivery failures that halt block production? (High)
